reviews.review_msg: Broc is a very knowledagble and passionate professor when it comes to poetry! One of my favourites at SFU. He really wants his students to do well, so if I didn't understand something he tried his best to clarify it. He marks essays fairly if you follow assignment criteria (and revisions). I would definitely take another English class with him!!

Excellent prof. Pay attention, do the readings, don't be lazy, and the assignments actually get interesting. It is obvious that Jonathon has high interest in what he teaches, which is what makes the lectures interesting.

Doesn't post up notes, so lots of writing notes during lecture. The free verse poems were...difficult. The assignments were doable. The prof is knowledgeable about his subject, but sometimes he leaves you wondering what exactly you learned. The final exam was not bad at all, just practice off the practice exam.

WHAT WAS THAT?? The final was horrible... Maybe instead of wasting 1 week on useless/unrelated guest poets he should have had review, what a joke this guy shouldn't been even teaching students at a university level yet alone at a elementary level.

His lectures are extremely boring and dry. He doesn't post up lecture slides or recordings so if you miss class then you get nothing. You will think, "why am I even here, how will this class EVER be USEFUL?" It won't. The course is all about over analyzing the literary devices and syllables in poems.

Our TA had some sort of personal crisis plus computer trouble and didn't bother to get someone to cover him.  The prof was MIA and didn't seem to care that the TA wasn't doing his job, despite many of us trying to contact him for support.  Worst educational experience of my adult life.

Awful professor. She labors over useless information and her lectures have little to do with the assignments. Do not take a class with her if you can help it. If I wasn't predisposed to English I probably would have done poorly. If you want an easy W credit avoid at all costs.

Horrible class, she barely uses a mic even though she is a soft speaker. Not a good public speaker a little shy, tends to . Seems really nice but starts to taunt students if they try to leave (mostly because no one can her). I like poetry but the class was awful, it was fairly graded I guess..
Dr. DeRoo is an excellent professor.  Excellent.  The best professor one could ever hope for.  Changed my life.
Class was very easy...he knew the true importance of teaching: to inspire students to want to learn and create a passion for literature...GREAT prof

Best prof I have ever had. Mike is amazing at lecturing and made me see poetry (and English in general) in a whole new way. TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM! He may expect a lot from you but it will be a great experience altogether.

Professor Everton was my favourite prof this semester. His lectures are so entertaining. I was never a really big fan of poetry but he was so inspirational that he made me love poetry! The grading for papers were pretty tough but the final was easy. If you come to all the lectures & not study for the final, you will be guaranteed at least a pass!

Amazing teacher! Dr. Everton clearly loves both teaching and the subject, and is super high energy and engaging. You won't have a lecture where he doesn't make you laugh out loud, even when you're reading depressing poems (which is very often, btw). The couse material is super interesting and made even more so by the way he teaches it! NO TEXTBOOK

Very good lecturer- very engaging, passionate about the subject. You WILL feel his affection for poetry. Encourages to seek for help if needed. Will slow down and repeat things several times if he wants you to know it word-for-word. Relatively light course load compared to other Engl 100 level classes- 2 papers and a final, not too much reading.

My interest in english and poetry is about as low as it can be. However, this course has been one of my favorites taken at SFU solely because Everton is such a great professor. Although a hard marker, his lectures are engaging and funny!
Very funny guy and an incredible lecturer. He is one of the best profs i've ever had at SFU! If you need a writing course, take it w/ him!!

Very good prof and very good at explaining things. I really learned a lot in the course. The marking was hard for a first year course, I am in my third year and this class I used as a med school requirement. I would take another class with him. Always willing to answer questions. Material was interesting. One of the best profs at SFU I'd say.
Awesome, awesome, awesome. Possibly the best class I have ever taken.

He makes the lectures very interesting and is clear about what he expects. It's not difficult to do well but make sure you interact with your TAs. Essays and final were very fair game, take notes! Awesome prof, this course has very little reading; recommended for people who need to fulfill their W requirement or enjoy interesting lectures.

Great prof! Took the course because I needed an english course and poetry seemed like one with time spent oon readings.  I ended up really enjoying the course.  He set realistic expectations for the class which was nice for a change. He has such a passion for the topic that it becomes infectuous. I highly recommend taking a class with him.

I think I was looking at her more than listening to her because she is smokin'! On the teaching side, holy moly she is pro at it as well. I was crying and surprised when each lecture ended. Captivating, helpful and super nice. Just take her classes and find out for yourself.

Pretty good prof. but depends on how your TA is really... Make sure you take really good notes of lectures because it will be VERY useful for the final. He'll give you a study guide and just study whatever is on there. He gives one essay and has an early due date(basically a chance for you to revise your paper if you don't like your mark)

This prof is amazing! Energetic, enthusiastic and extremely intelligent and interested in his subject. The lectures are interesting, and the textbook covers a wide range of subject matter. However, I wouldn't recommend this class if you have no interest in poetry whatsoever. With some interest, the class becomes both challenging and fun! Love it.

I took poetry because I did not want to read 5 novels in a semester, I don't even like poetry! But he was an AWESOME prof, made lectures interessting, made me want to come to class - I now have a new appreciation for poetry. Not much work, pretty much a "cupcake class" :P I recommend it!
Includes five papers which are worth 60% of the total mark and the marking is very unfair. I would not recommend this course.
Worst English course.Is the course really an introductory course???

Never take this course if you are looking to improve your GPA.Also don't take this course if you are interested in poetry. I loved poetry before I took this course, but I hate it now. Matt himself is a TA which is unfair for others. It is not at all an introductory course.       Don't regret afterwards, believe me its the worst it can ever be.

All he does is read from his notebook, teaching hundreds of poem. NO clear focus in the class. Hard to grasp which aspect of poetry he wants you to focus on. No clear direction in the class. In terms of difficulty, it is quite difficult as a freshman course. If this is your thing, then you will enjoy. Otherwise, take something else.

To the person below me, who would consider Michelle engaging. I have a gpa over 4 (at least 1/2 a brain last time i checked) and found this class to be the biggest waste of time. I have to agree that the final was easy, but a prof should make it so students want to come to class...she did not.

Michelle is an excellent and capable teacher. Those who dislike her do not have the capacity to analyze or enjoy poetry. Through her I lectures I found her to be an interesting, cheerful and helpful person. For those with the interest and half a brain, she was engaging. A+! (Easy final, too:))
Boring class. Throws her interpretations of a poem at you and calls it final.

Boring class ever. I enjoyed English in high school too, but this just sucked. Stopped going to class about half-way in...just couldn't take it. Worst of all is that the other English classes aren't much better...good this it's not my major.

i totally agree with the comment below mine. she TOTALLY killed english for me...and i used to LOVE it in grade 12!!! finals are impossible...i barely finished in time and in the end i don't even know what i wrote about...my answers turned out to be just as disorganized as her class! she sucks!

She just about killed poetry for me. Did not seem too enthused with the subject, lecture was boring, no new material/ terminology unless you've missed English 8-12. Agree with all she says, it'll save you a bite in the behind when you get your essays back.
I really enjoy her lectures and her style, but that's because I put the time in to get acquainted with her style. She's got interesting methods, that's for sure.
don't get what she's talking about, and notes are super long and there's never enough time to get it all down. class lacks an aspect of humanity.

lectures are quite dull.. but content is straight forward + easy to understand. i skipped around 1/2 the lectures and still managed a B+.. truly cares about her students, kinda motherly almost.. might seem annoying but u can tell she wants the best

not a bad teacher, but god, if you take poetry, she'll make you sing and all that.  not only that, she tried to take attendance in a 250 student lecture, and she tries to remember everybody's names.....
Doesnt write anything down,Extremely boring to listen too, Assignments are terrible. BUT she is very attractive so it makes up for it
Great Prof!! extremely halpful..classes were fun! 2 essays in the course. If you really work hard on them, you can get an easy A
Dr. Collis was engaging, interesting, funny and insightful. He brought in many wonderful guest poets and his lectures were engagindg. I enjoyed him and his teaching style.
Interesting prof.
This guy bugged me. Nothing wrong with his teaching, just his attitude. Unless you are a huge fan of modern poetry and Stephen Collis, don't take his class. WW>SC

Collis's poetry class is awesome, basically beccause the tests are an absolute joke and there's no point whatsoever in going to lecture. When I did go, lectures were pretty interesting, and he has a cool way of paralleling "classic" poetry with more contemporary stuff. Fun guy, loves to talk to students in the hall and take suggestions.
this class is awesome and i love it but dont bother going to lectures.

Although I can't bring myself to rate Collis down due to what a nice guy he is, I warn you: If you are taking his poetry class you will start to wonder why you're paying to go to his lectures. Even the people who pay attention barely take notes. Feel free to skip. You won't miss anything.
No Comments
